name: NPR
text: U.S. Surgeon General Jerome Adams says the country's COVID-19 crisis worsening because people aren't taking mitigation measures as seriously as before. https://t.co/M1AP0qTamv

name: NPR
text: Parler is now one of the most downloaded smartphone apps. Backed by conservative activist and donor Rebekah Mercer, it bills itself as a "free speech" social network that puts few restrictions on what users can post. https://t.co/Nkine2MkP3

name: NPR
text:
Opinion: We may not be able to defeat, overwhelm, or kick the coronavirus in the backside - more metaphors that now fall flat, says @nprscottsimon. 

But each day, we can help each other, and rise above fatigue and despair.
https://t.co/9F3s3js3K6

name: NPR
text: It's the busiest Atlantic hurricane season on record. When Iota makes landfall early next week, it could drop up more than 2 feet of rain in an area still recovering from Hurricane Eta. https://t.co/eb78SxE57S

name: NPR
text: Diwali celebrations may look a lot different this year. Still, just like the holiday, Kamala Harris' election win is seen as a new beginning and a fresh start for Hindus. https://t.co/W8NQQ0fCRR

name: NPR
text:
Helga Davis talks with Lara Downes about transcending time and place ‚Äî finding profound connections through the walls and miles that separate us ‚Äî and imagining new dimensions for creativity and collaboration.
https://t.co/eZ2J3EZcEf

name: NPR
text: A federal judge has ruled that Chad Wolf was not legally serving as the acting secretary of homeland security when he issued rules that stopped new applicants to the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program. https://t.co/QmQZ3fjTMp

name: NPR
NPR
text: As Jim Carrey works on his best Joe Biden for 'Saturday Night Live,' we ask other impressionists how they've done it. Darrell Hammond says he wishes people understood how tough impressions really are. https://t.co/XJ4UbV12UR

name: NPR
text: Netflix's eight-episode series "Dash & Lily" has the sparkle and the swoon that a lot of holiday romances lack, says critic @lindaholmes. https://t.co/XUY5yAufFp

name: NPR
text: Whole coops full of chickens are being massacred -- but not eaten -- around Bethel, Alaska. The culprit seem to be mink that "kind of overdo it" when they find  their prey conveniently contained. @KYUKNews https://t.co/mdVDcGQ32x

name: NPR
text: It'll be tough to top the desk ‚Äì and the home setup ‚Äì for this Tiny Desk: The location is the home, and not so tiny writing desk, of Aaron Copland. Michael Boriskin plays Copland's work on the composer's own piano. https://t.co/YVxAHMAQiQ

name: NPR
text:
The difference between art and crime depends on who you ask. 

Just as hip-hop was on the brink of becoming the most-consumed genre in the country, mixtapes ‚Äî a product essential to hip-hop's survival ‚Äî became a scapegoat for the music industry's collapse.
https://t.co/PKznk598yP

name: NPR
text:
Review: Megan Rapinoe's new memoir, "One Life," is mostly a call to action.

It tells the story of her own political awakening, in the hopes others will follow in her footsteps ‚Äî and understand they have an imperative to speak out about injustice.
https://t.co/4whoa4RpR2

name: NPR
text: RT @lourdesgnavarro: I spoke with @RKempNewsDaily -- who was sitting in her car in front of where the recount is underway in Clayton County. She operates her own news website after she was laid off by the local paper. She is the sole journalist covering Clayton County.  Hero. https://t.co/QHXikBtKl1

name: NPR
text:
A day of rallying that echoed false claims of a stolen election turned violent around 8 p.m., when Trump supporters armed with batons and counterprotesters collided in a brawl five blocks from the White House.
https://t.co/9lSrTbAt5S

name: NPR
text:
Chad Wolf's July memo that "effectively suspended DACA" is invalid, a federal judge says, because Wolf wasn't legally serving as the acting DHS secretary when he issued it.
https://t.co/yc6MPqSQA2

name: NPR
text: RT @MaraLiasson: Occasional NPR commentator https://t.co/A4hJxhwa37

name: NPR
text: Join us, Friday, November 20th, 3pm ET for a Live conversation with the hosts of @louderthanariot. They'll dive deep into the podcast, and the years of research, reporting, and storytelling that brought it to life. Have a question for the team? Ask it here https://t.co/dScHGEJPIv

name: NPR
text: Three NASA astronauts and one Japanese astronaut plan to lift off for the International Space Station aboard a SpaceX rocket tonight. The mission is billed as the first of many that will ferry astronauts to and from the ISS. https://t.co/qQqacTcf8x

name: NPR
text:
RT @throughlineNPR: America has the oldest, active constitution on the planet.

The reason for that? Because many other countries have scrapped their original documents over time and replaced them with modern constitutions.

More here: https://t.co/h2LMOou4LF https://t.co/cMfXMDCY9Z

name: NPR
text:
Chef and writer Katie Workman: "I find it incredibly impressive on any given day when somebody prepares a nourishing thoughtful meal for themselves. I think that that is such a beautiful act of self care."
 https://t.co/yHJ96vfrF3

name: NPR
text:
RT @stphnfwlr: NEW on @gpbnews: Sen. David Perdue has declined to participate in a proposed @atlpressclub debate against Jon Ossoff, after the first-term Senator also pulled out of a debate days before 11/3 to appear at a rally with President Trump. #gapol

https://t.co/n7sZe5Gchr

name: NPR
text: In 2000, 537 votes in Florida swung the Electoral College. This year, Biden leads Trump by tens of thousands of votes across multiple key states. Recounts and hollow fraud claims are very, very unlikely to change that. https://t.co/BrfH2l61oe
